results.title: The Rise of big business
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Kenneth Vose
results.brief_description: Through a study of the values, aspirations and achievements of Andrew Carnegie, John D. Rockefeller and J.P. Morgan, the effect these men had on the growth of great business enterprises and the further effect those enterprises had on American society is shown. Life among coalminers and in the slums contrast with the lifestyle of the rich and show the direct relationship between the monopolistic practices, ruthless competition and expropriation, and the lives of the poor.

results.title: The Rise and fall of the Great Lakes
results.brief_description: A canoe journey through the beautiful areas of the Great Lakes, formed over 10,000 years ago over successive Ice Ages. This geological and ecological history of the Great Lakes is accompanied by narration in ballad form. Eventually, the advance of civilisation becomes obvious with bulldozers felling trees and pushing earth, huge dams, ocean-going ships, factory chimney’s belching smoke and the effects of waste pollution on the Lakes themselves.

results.title: The Rise and fall of Squizzy Taylor
results.brief_description: Sneak thief, racketeer, standover man and murderer. The story of Squizzy Taylor, Melbourne’s Public Enemy No.1 told through old newspaper cuttings, photos, newsreel and re-enactment.

results.title: The Rink [Silent version]
results.brief_description: In this sketch, derived partly from an old Karno sketch, Chaplin portrays a waiter who spends lunchtime at a roller rink. A comic excursion in Chaplinesque humour and movement involving a love story and Chaplin’s fandangos on the rink.

results.title: The Rink
results.brief_description: A Sunday afternoon at the community skating rink in the park. Rhythmic music from a load speaker urges everyone to strike out boldly on his won, even the toddler. Girls pair off to flash their skates in the wig-wag movement of the twist, and past them speed boys in gay hockey sweaters. Without words, the film conveys the relaxed zest of a bright winter day.

results.title: The Ring within [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Eric Michel and Dan Bigras
results.brief_description: Dan Bigras, Canadian singer and filmmaker, features in his own documentary along with his extreme fighter friends, Charles Ali Nestor (27 y.o.), David Loiseau (21 y.o.) and Steve Vigneault (22 y.o.) to demonstrate that an outlet can be found for those who find themselves battling with self-destructive impulses or overwhelming uncontrollable anger and rage. Where Bigras uses singing and song-writing as his outlet, his friends prefer to channel their energies into martial arts and extreme fighting as a way of rebuilding their lives. It would seem a common thread runs through the lives of each of these young men as they tell their stories of an unhappy childhood, bullying, teenage gangs, violence and family break-down. But the frankness and honesty in their personal tales and the friendship, loyalty and support between the four men in their collective struggle to transform their anger into a rage for life is what really defines this film, not the fighting scenes - their courage is to be admired. Features interviews with families, friends, sporting personnel and other extreme fighters and includes graphic coverage of bouts from competition fights and training sessions. In English and French with English subtitles. WARNING: CONTAINS GRAPHIC IMAGES OF EXTREME FIGHT SCENES.

results.title: The Ring (Musical score)
results.creator_credit: British International Pictures, John Maxwell and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s first film for British International pictures is a foray into virtuoso camera moves, odd angles, ingenious narrative devices and several expressionistic point-of-view sequences. The end result is a love triangle story given the unique Hitchcock treatment. Up and coming boxer, ‘One Round’ Jack Sander suspects his wife, Nelly’s attentions are drifting to those of another - rival champion, Bob Corby. Whereas Sander is young and self assured, Corby is sophisticated and socially aware - attributes that appeal to the young wife, who leaves her husband for him. The film culminates in a showdown between Round One and Corby, the watchful eyes of Nelly on those she has loved and must choose between. The film’s title has several applications - the marriage band, the boxing ring and the secret bracelet from a tryst. The film has been praised for it’s ability to capture social detail, as well as using expressionist visual devices to convey a character’s state of mind (Geoff Andrew). Note: The film has been digitally mastered and features a new music score composed by Neil Brand. Cast includes Carl Brisson, Lilian Hall Davis, Ian Hunter, Forrester Harvey and Gordon Harker.

results.title: The Right whale: an endangered species
results.brief_description: Zoologist Roger Payne, on location in Argentina, discusses the characteristics of the Southern Right Whale, rarest of the great whales, including their feeding and communication habits.
